lines.text: Philip, are you a millionaire?
Umm... No?
Then shut up and keep writing
[Cynthia has just driven Mike and his sports car into a lake]
If you're not out of here in about three seconds, I'm gonna put ya over my knee... I'm gonna paddle your bottom until it's as red as that jalopy you're drivin'!

[Cynthia has just driven Mike and his racing car into a pond]
Hey! You're all wet! I saw you last night at the Crazy Club, you sing great!
You know you could've got me killed!
You sure killed me! Oh, and what you do with a song! Do you know it was all I could to to keep from jumping up on that stage.
Aw, knock it off will you? You just demolished me and you stand there yapping as if nothing happened!
You're cute!
No, you're cute!
The way you sing, the way you drive, the way you get mad! Mike, I really go for you!
Honey, I'm just about to go for you!
Oooh! I can hardly wait!
If you're not out of here in about three seconds, I'm gonna put you over my knee, I'm gonna paddle your bottom until it's as red as that jalopy you're driving!
But I'm only wearing it!
That's good because you're gonna feel it too!
[Mike steps down from his car and falls deeper in the water to the top of his head]

[Cynthia laughs]
So long, Mike... For now!

[Repeating after Cynthia in snide mockery,]
"So long, Mike, for now!"
As soon as I domesticate you - get you housebroken - you'll be the best husband a girl ever had.
Husband?

[clangs her cymbals to interrupt the conversation]
Over my dead body!

[as Mike test drives Foxhugh's Fox 5 car on the racetrack]
Sure knows how to handle that car!
Well, best driver on any track!
Yeah, it looks like your plan worked.
Yeah!
You seem pretty anxious to have Mike drive for me.
Oh, yeah, well the prize money is good.
You see, Mr. Foxhugh, if we keep him busy driving, he won't have any time for your kid.
[Les kicks Larry in the leg]
Ow! Hey what did you kick me for?
Cynthia?
Yeah, if we don't break this up they're liable to do something terrible like get married.
[Les kicks Curly in the leg]
Ow! What did you kick me for?
It's nothing to worry about. Cynthia isn't even Mike's type.
Oh, well sure! Who'd want to marry a gorgeous millionairess?
Yeah!
Not me.
[Larry and Curly both at once kick Les in the leg. She screams in pain]
Ow! Oh! Ow! Oh!
That's right, and as soon as I domesticate you - get you housebroken - you'll be the best husband a girl ever had.
Husband?
I'm glad you like the car, and we're going to give you a chance to drive it, but you've got to promise me one thing.
Well, let's have it!
Don't encourage Cynthia!
Cynthia? What's she got to do with it?
Well, I didn't mind you singing for her. That was her birthday present, but now she is talking about marriage, and that, of course, is out of the question.
You're trying to say I'm good enough to drive your car, but I'm not good enough to marry your daughter?
Oh, now, Mike, don't put it that way!
I'll put it this way - if I want to marry Cynthia, and she wants to marry me, we'll get married! As for your car, you can drive it yourself!

[as Lt. Richards enters her kitchen through the back door]
What? Is this a raid?
Yeah, reach for the ceiling! Now turn around.
[When she complies, he slaps her derriere]
I just wanted to see if you packed a gun.
I'd rather stay single, do the things I like to do, race, sing...
Excuse me, I seem to be bumping your binoculars.
Wow! That was some book!
I saw the movie, and it was dirty!
